titleStmt.title: Hugh Mosher, Account of Estate Administration in Dartmouth: a digital transcription

publicationStmt.p: Christopher A. Mosher, Shelton, CT, USA, 2018.

sourceDesc.bibl: County of Bristol (Massachusetts, USA), [Probate] Records, No. 3, 1710–1721, 220–1, account of administration, Hugh Mosher, recorded 6 Jun 1715; digital images, Probates, v. 1–4 1687–1723, FHL microfilm 461,882, DGS 7703530, item 3, images 433–4 of 745.

body.p:
The Accompt of Iames Mosher of Dartmouth in the County of Bristol
&cet cetera: and Daniel Sabeers of newport on Rhod Island in his Majesties Col
=lony of Rhode Island : Executors to the last will & Testament of Hugh —
Mosher late of dartmouth deceased as well of and for so and executors
of all & singuler the Goods and chattells of Hugh Mosher aforeseid
Deceased as well of and for such & so much of the same Goods & Chattells
as come to their hands as of and for their payments & disbursments
out of the same as followeth

row.cell: s
d

The said Accomptants chargeth themselues with all &
singuler the goods and chattells of the sd Deceased specifyed
in an Inventory thereof made and exhibitted into þethe
Regr office for the County of Bristol
decembr 7th 1713
and bears date
10 of nouembr 1713
amounting as by
the same Inventory appeareth to the sum of

And petitions for allowance as followeth
ImprsImprimis the sd accomptants desire Allowance of the
several charges of the sd deceased as followeth as
and by them payd and disbursted vi⁊tvidelicet

The Charges of the Probate of his will and for fune
rall expenses :
Decembr 7th 1713
payd to Collonel Paine
Iudge of probate by daniel Sabeers

December the 8th 17151713
payd to mr Cary Regist by
Iames Mosher— — — } —

December the 12th: 1713
payd to Iohn Bayly Iunr one of
the witnesses to the sd will for his goeing to Bristol &
his horss and Feriage by daniel Sabeers— — — }

payd to Samuel Roades one of the wittnesses goeing to
Bristol two dayes and horss hire by daniel Sabeers— }

payd to Iohn Stanton for his horss hyre to Iohn Sabeers
one of the witnesses to goe to Bristol by Daniel Sabeers}

payd to Iohn Sabeers one of the witnesses goeing to
Bristoll by daniel Sabeers— — — — — — }

payd for the Frriage for Iohn Sabeer and Samuel
Rhodes by daniel Sabeers— — — — }

I payd for me daniel Sabeers for my ferriage to
Dartmouth & Bristol & back againe & expence abot estate
in taken an Inventory— — — — — — —
To three pound of suger for his funiroll payd widow Mosher
To mr Tripp digging his grave— — — — —
To making his coffin for him
Carryed over sum of
s
d
Brought over from the other side the sum of—

Then the Accomptants desireth allowance of certain
Debts due by Deceased at his death wch they haue since
his death payd and discharged as followeth

To money payd Iosiah Bliss by Daniel Sabeers
the sum of — — — — — — — — — — }

To money payd for Taxes Levyed on his estate in
Dartmouth since his Death payd by Iames Mosher sum

Payd Ioseph Tillinghast in full of all accounts of my
father by me Iames Mosher the sum of— — }

Payd to George Lawton in full of all accounts due
from my father the sum of — — — — —

payd to Iohn Mosher for a debt due from my father
by me Iames Mosher the sum of — — —

payd for my Ferriage & expence while there at Bristol
upon account of my Administcon & expense at Ferry
till I got over by daniel Sabeers — — — —

payd to mr Cary Regr for a coppy of the record &
recording the order of the Iudge of Probates for
further time to make up our accounts by danl Sabeers

To my horss Hyre and comeing to Bristol the
second time to giue an acount of our Administcon
by daniel Sabeers— — — — — —

To Daniel Sabeers Ferrage & expence in comeing
about the same— — — — — — —

Iune 6 : 1715
then signed by us : Iames Mosher
Daniel Sabeers
To allowing and Registeing the account—

body.p:
By the Honrable Nathal Paine Iudge of Probates &cet cetera
mr Iames Mosher & mr Daniel Sabeers presented the aboue
written and made Oath that it containe a Iust & true accompt
of their Administcon on the estate of mr Hugh Mosher lat of
dartmouth deceased so far as they haue proceeded which account
accordingly I do allow and Approue off
Iurrt Coram Nathal Paine

Entered
Iune the 6 : 1715
By Iohn Cary Regr.
